articles.author: Steve Holland, Parisa Hafezi, Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: Iran and Israel traded further air attacks on Thursday as President Donald Trump kept the world guessing about whether the United States would join Israel's bombardment of Iranian nuclear facilities.
articles.title: Iran, Israel trade fresh air attacks as Trump weighs US involvement

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Phil Stewart, Steve Holland, Jonathan Landay
articles.description: Roughly one month ago, from the stage at an investment forum in Saudi Arabia, U.S. President Donald Trump issued a warning to Iran that would prove prophetic.
articles.title: Insight: How Trump, a self-proclaimed "peacemaker," embraced Israel's campaign against Iran

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine and Russia exchanged prisoners of war on Thursday, officials from both countries said, the latest round of swaps under an agreement struck in Istanbul.
articles.title: Ukraine and Russia exchange POWs in latest swap

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Ebrahim Hajjaj
articles.description: Like thousands of other Palestinians in Gaza, Hind Al-Nawajha takes a dangerous, miles-long journey every day to try to get some food for her family, hoping she makes it back alive.
articles.title: As death toll rises, Gazans make life-risking journeys to seek food

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British lawmakers will vote on Friday on whether to proceed with a bill to legalise assisted dying for terminally ill people, in what would be the biggest social reform in the country for a generation.
articles.title: British lawmakers to vote on landmark assisted dying law

articles.author: Jaspreet Singh, Cassell Bryan-Low
articles.description: SpaceX's massive Starship spacecraft exploded into a dramatic fireball during testing in Texas, the latest in a series of setbacks for Elon Musk’s Mars rocket program.
articles.title: SpaceX Starship rocket explodes in setback to Musk's Mars mission

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: The White House said on Thursday that President Donald Trump will make a decision on whether the U.S. will get involved in the Israel-Iran conflict in the next two weeks.
articles.title: Trump to decide on US action in Israel-Iran conflict within 2 weeks, White House says

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iran's fragmented opposition groups think their moment may be close at hand, but activists involved in previous bouts of protest say they are unwilling to unleash mass unrest, even against a system they hate, with their nation under attack.
articles.title: Iran's divided opposition senses its moment but activists remain wary of protests

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Australia has suspended operations at its embassy in Tehran due to the deteriorating security environment in Iran and has directed the departure of all Australian officials, Foreign Minister Penny Wong said on Friday.
articles.title: Australia closes Iran embassy citing deteriorating security environment

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli military strikes hit Iran's Khondab Heavy Water Research Reactor, a project under construction that had not begun operating, and damaged the nearby plant that makes heavy water, the U.N. nuclear watchdog said on Thursday.
articles.title: Israeli strikes hit Iranian reactor being built, nearby plant, IAEA says
